headline: Mesa park rangers mimic teen gang to beat up homeless people | Opinion
context: It turns out that the “Gilbert Goons” are not only a predator gang of mostly well-off teens who attacked innocent victims in the East Valley, culminating in the killing of 16-year-old Preston Lord and leading to seven murder charges being filed by the Maricopa County Attorney’s Office.
It turns out that the goons are also — heaven help us — an inspiration.

annotations.paragraph: An article by The Arizona Republic’s Maritza Dominguez describes an ugly, 60-page police report detailing how park rangers in Mesa formed their own “Goon Squad,” complete with embroidered patches, then targeted homeless people.
annotations.reason: This paragraph provides essential details about the formation of the 'Goon Squad' by Mesa park rangers and their targeting of homeless people.

annotations.paragraph: One of the rangers, Joshua Amado, was arrested on April 22 on suspicion of possession of a stolen firearm, which the report said he found in the backpack of a homeless man.
annotations.reason: This paragraph provides specific information about an arrest related to the misconduct of the park rangers.

annotations.paragraph: City officials, stating the obvious, said they were “deeply disturbed by the preliminary findings."
annotations.reason: This paragraph includes a reaction from city officials, which is relevant to the misconduct issue.

annotations.paragraph: Mesa City Manager Chris Brady, in the prepared statement, added that the city has “zero tolerance for this type of misconduct.”
annotations.reason: This paragraph provides a direct quote from a city official about the city's stance on the misconduct.

annotations.paragraph: Adding that, “The actions uncovered during this investigation do not reflect Mesa’s values or the standards we expect from public servants.”
annotations.reason: This paragraph continues the official statement, reinforcing the city's position on the issue.

annotations.paragraph: They do say something about society’s values and standards, though. Or what’s lacking.
annotations.reason: This paragraph is a vague generalization about societal values and does not contribute new information.

annotations.paragraph: The behavior of this particular batch of goons, though disgusting, wasn’t deemed to be prosecutable by the Maricopa County Attorney’s Office, however.
annotations.reason: This paragraph provides specific information about the legal decision regarding the goons' behavior.

annotations.paragraph: The prosecutor’s office told The Republic that the case was “turned down due to no reasonable likelihood of conviction.”
annotations.reason: This paragraph offers a direct quote from the prosecutor's office explaining the legal decision.

annotations.paragraph: Meantime, the city is conducting an independent investigation of misconduct, using an outside counsel.
annotations.reason: This paragraph provides new information about the city's response to the situation.

annotations.paragraph: And it has decided as well to transfer command of the 16-person park rangers unit from the Parks, Recreation and Community Facilities Department to the Mesa Police Department, in order “to ensure appropriate oversight and professional standards are maintained.”
annotations.reason: This paragraph details a specific action taken by the city in response to the issue.
